utterances.utterance: It's a very interesting story because you mentioned these tech giants in the private sector, they had already been targeting Alex Jones. utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.utterance: That basically the kids were not murdered.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.utterance: And their parents were very -- to say that they were upset about that would be the understatement of the century.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Of course, so was there something new specifically that he has been saying recently on the airwaves or on Twitter that's now brought the hammer down?

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.utterance: Yes, there was specifically video recently where he was talking about pick up your battle rifles that basically, we are going to go after the media. And I think that's why Twitter and some of the other platforms said this may be inciting violence, this may be crossing a line.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Has this ever happened before to anybody?

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.utterance: So we did a lot of research on people who have been knocked off Twitter, other platforms and we couldn't find someone with a following like this. Are there cases where somebody with 50 followers, 100 followers has been kicked out because they post something offensive, inciting violence, yes, of course. There are plenty of those, but not someone who has the thousands and thousands of followers that "Infowars" has.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, well, also a huge media story this week, I believe 380 editorials all came together and wrote a response to President Trump calling them fake news the enemy of the people. Now out of 380 editorials come out criticizing Trump, how is that different than any other day?

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.utterance: Well, that's a good point, which is that, there were some in the White House who were agitated about it, but Kellyanne Conway said "Why?" They rail against the president every single day, and by the way, it's more than that. It bleeds into the news pages. That's really the story. That's what the President is targeting, not editorial pages. Fox has editorials. Fox has op-eds essentially. When Sean Hannity comes on, the primetime shows, people have opinion, people have edge. We make that distinction. So the New York Times can have a liberal editorial page, the Wall Street Journal can have a conservative editorial page. I think what clearly frustrates the President more is that that editorial position on any given issue bleeds oftentimes into the news pages. And another important distinction, when the President first tweeted about the enemy of the American people months and months ago, he said fake news was the enemy of the American people. That's different than saying the entire media.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's a big distinction and I know what he is saying because these newspaper editors and the pundits and all of these correspondents were not tough against President Obama. They did the President's bidding back then, so they have a lot more credibility when they say now, "Oh, you know what, we're just being honest journalists. We're trying to hold powerful people accountable." They don't have a leg to stand on, on that issue. He is saying there the enemy because for the last year and a half, they have called him the enemy. They've called him the enemy of the Constitution, of minorities, of the rule of law, and he is a counterpuncher. He hits back and he says, the fake news is the enemy of the people because the fake news isn't telling the American people the truth. They are biased, they are very slanted and they are denying the people the right information. They are not reporting the good things he does. They are not giving him any credit for the good things. They are just not fair and balanced.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.utterance: And I hear you say that a lot about the counterpunching. When people complain about the president's tweets, "Oh, he attacked someone." Oftentimes, somebody attacks him ...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's not out of the blue.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.utterance: He goes back and says, "Look, I'm not going to take this." And a lot of his supporters obviously love that especially when he is taking on the mainstream media. Here is a final point I'd make on that, though, I don't think a lot of conservatives can complain and whine about editorial pages speaking out. They have First Amendment rights, too, and so if the President could counter punch, people in the media have every right to push back especially on the editorial pages.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right, they can dish it back but they can't take it. All right, Ed Henry, whose pocket square costs more than your car. The green party candidate who played spoiler in last week's special election enters "Watters' World," even though he believes he's descended from another world.

utterances.speaker: ROBERT GRAY, CORRESPONDENT, FOX NEWS
utterances.utterance: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Robert Gray in Los Angeles. A new development in the Robert Mueller Russia investigation. The New York Times reporting that White House counsel Don McGahn has been cooperating extensively with the Special Counsel. The Times writes that McGahn voluntarily participated in 30 hours of interviews giving investigators an inside look at the firing of James Comey and other issues related to potential obstruction of justice. McGahn was reportedly told to cooperate via President Trump's first legal team and the president as well. The number of people who have died in the bridge collapse in Italy now rising to 43. A Genoa hospital official says the truck driver who suffered severe injuries has died. Meanwhile, mourners attended a state funeral today to honor the victims. Italy's President is demanding guarantees that all of his country's roads are safe. Now back to "Watters' World."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Democrats have been blaming Russian meddling on Hillary's devastating loss for almost two years. So it's not surprising some are using the same excuse to explain last week's special election loss in Ohio. Actress Alyssa Milano tweeting, "You know what sucks? Because of our unwillingness to pass policy that protects our election integrity, I immediately think the green party votes tonight are Russian meddling. Why else would anyone cast a protest vote in Ohio when there is so much at stake." Pretty sure the green party candidate was not a part of Russian meddling. He couldn't even remember his own campaign website address during an interview. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: To donate to your campaign or volunteer, do you have a website?

utterances.speaker: JOE MANCHIK, OHIO GREEN PARTY CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes. I definitely have a website and there's a donate page -- there's a link for the donate page at the top of the website.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Awesome, and then could you tell us what that website is?

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: Off the top of my head, I don't remember.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Joining me, Ohio green party candidate Joe Manchik. Joe, do you remember the website now at least?

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's manchikforcongress.wordpress.com.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: WordPress got it. All right, good.

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: Yes, and let me say something because that was not supposed to be released to the public. That was a private chat that I had with someone and that should have never have been released to anyone. That was just private chat that I had on Skype, actually.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I don't know how that got out there, but it is out there.

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: I don't either.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, you know ...

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: I know it's out there ...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Maybe it's the Russians. Maybe that's who released ...

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let me get to your platform here because a lot of Democrats are blaming you for costing them that special election House seat. You picked up over a thousand votes. It was a razor thin margin, so you are being blamed as a spoiler. But let's get into your platform here. You want every American to grow hemp. You say every American should be required to grow hemp.

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: Now, I never said that. That's some crap that was published in "The Daily Mail." It's a British news tabloid and ...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So what is your position?

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: ... it was all kinds of false information about me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What is your position on hemp?

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: I believe it should be legalized. It should be -- well, all the laws regulating hemp should be abolished. Our founding fathers suggested that everybody should grow hemp in America for the production of paper and other products. It's an amazing crop that could -- it should be a farm crop just like soybeans and corn in America. That's my view on hemp and that's the beauty of the Green Party.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right, just get those tariffs off there and we're going to be home free. What do you feel about Israel as it relates to American security?

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: In my view the Israeli terrorist regime of war criminal Benjamin Netanyahu should be completely defunded. We should not be sending our money to Israel. We need to stop war criminals like Benjamin Netanyahu who is ...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Do you think calling our ally in the Middle East Benjamin Netanyahu a war criminal is going to get you votes?.

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't really care. It's a fact.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay, well ...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think, it's a fact to you, but I don't think it's a fact to most of Americans.

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: Well, the things that Israel has done to the Palestinian people is truly shameful.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay, what is your position on taxes? Do you think we should raise or lower taxes?

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: Taxes should be lowered for the American people and we should have a substantial increase on corporate taxes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You almost had me there. You were so close, I was about to agree with you. All right, well you got half of that right. What do you feel about ...

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: No, I got it all right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: ... okay, in your opinion. What do you fgeel about the border? Should we build the wall or should we just let them all come over?

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: We should provide a means for anyone and everyone to enter the United States and become an American citizen if they want to do so, that's my view.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Everybody. Everybody can just come in and become US citizens wherever they are? Whoever they are?

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: That's what this country was founded on. I agree. I believe that we should not be building walls between countries. We should be building bridges.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay, so if MS-13 wants to hop on the bridge from Mexico to America, you are okay with that?

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: Who?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Never mind. I said MS-13, the vicious gang in Central America that dismembers people? Anyway, I want to ask you one last question here. One last question, you say you are descended or your parents are descended from outer space aliens?

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: No, i didn't say that. I said my distant relatives.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: That's a silly Facebook post that I put on my Facebook page probably 10 years ago before I even thought about running for Congress. And it's still up there, if you want to go to my personal Facebook page, you can read all about it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay, so you do believe you are descended from aliens from outer space?

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: The human race could be descended from aliens on another planet. Who knows? But I didn't come here to talk about that. I came here to talk about our Green Party legislative goals that the American people are demanding that the Democratic Party and Republican Party do not want to talk about.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, well listen, everybody go to your website ...

utterances.speaker: MANCHIK
utterances.utterance: It's manchikforcongress.wordpress.com.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Got it. All right, everybody, check it out to find out what the Green Party is all about. Joe, thank you very much. The liberal media now calling MS-13 members nice kids who ride bikes. Oh my god. Tomi Lahren is fired up, next.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: We have people coming into the country or trying to come in. We are stopping a lot of them. We are taking people out of the country. You wouldn't believe how bad these people are. These aren't people, these are animals.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That is President Trump referring to members of MS-13, a dangerous street gang responsible for violent deaths of dozens across the United States.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: These are the faces of three alleged MS-13 gang members and two associates that the County Police say plotted to abduct and murder a 16-year-old boy. In recent years the gang has since resurfaced, extorting businesses, taking advantage of illegal immigrants. It's the gang from El Salvador that has thousands of members here in the US. It is one of the most of ruthless gangs in recent memory using bats and machetes to beat, stab and dismember victims. Authorities say at least 17 people on Long Island, many of them teenagers have been brutally murdered in the last two years.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But if you ask some in the liberal media, MS-13 members are really not that bad.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: The typical MS-13 gang member in the actually looks like one of these young men on Facebook. They are around 18 years old. They like selfies and memes about the Joker.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: The MS-13 members that I've been following are working after school jobs, they're living with their parents. They get around Long Island on bicycles because they can't afford cars.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: It can be hard to tell who is really in the gang and who is just adopting gang style.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Kids in high school wear Chicago Bulls t-shirts or will wear Nike Cortez sneakers and that is a sign of the gang, but it's also just a sign of a high school kid trying to look tough.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Joining me now with reaction, Fox News contributor, Tomi Lahren and Democratic strategist, Robin Biro. Robin, I have to start with you because you are up against it in this one here.

utterances.speaker: ROBIN BIRO, DEMOCRATIC STRATEGIST
utterances.utterance: Yes. I know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Why do you think the media is trying to white wash the dangerous MS-13 street gang? Don't they understand how dangerous they are? Every gang task force leader in this country will tell you that these people are brutal, they are horrible and they are vicious and are an incredible danger to the streets of America.

utterances.speaker: BIRO
utterances.utterance: Of course. Yes, of course, and you are speaking to a spec ops veteran here. So, I am all about physical security. I've watched the entirety of that seven-minute long video. They started out pretty descent when they said that they commit horrific crimes, very brutal crimes. I was with them on board there, but when they started really trying to humanize these people, that's where they lost me and I started to get concerned. And you know, my party, in my humble opinion hasn't done enough to acknowledge the fact that it is a problem. At least in that video, they did say at the very end that this actually an American problem. And Nancy Pelosi when she came under fire for her remarks about Donald Trump calling immigrants as a whole not just MS-13 animals, she tried to invoke her faith and all of that. I just don't think that she came far enough. She just says that that was ...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, listen, it's a disgrace the way that the media and the Democrats have treated this gang. Tomi, I mean, just this week alone, the Democrats and the media have praised Antifa and now, they are praising MS- 13. This is just a vicious group of people, is it not?

utterances.speaker: BIRO
utterances.utterance: Oh, it's terrible.

utterances.speaker: TOMI LAHREN, CONTRIBUTOR, FOX NEWS
utterances.utterance: To clarify, President Trump -- to clarify, President Trump did not call all immigrants animals. He was specifically referring to MS-13. And if that upsets Nancy Pelosi ...

utterances.speaker: BIRO
utterances.utterance: After the fact.

utterances.speaker: LAHREN
utterances.utterance: ... that tells you where her priorities are. But furthermore ...

utterances.speaker: BIRO
utterances.utterance: Tomi, that was after the fact though.

utterances.speaker: LAHREN
utterances.utterance: ... the Democratic Party has a love affair with illegal immigration. Point blank, period. They have a love affair with illegal immigration. They will do whatever it takes to romanticize and to white wash gangs like MS-13 tells it's an American problem. It's not just an American problem, it's an illegal immigration problem. When the Democrats can finally recognize that, maybe we can get somewhere, but until then, you've got to have that as your party's platform. Nancy Pelosi is saying, yes, MS-13 is not so bad.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, Robin, I mean, this is just in Maryland alone. This guy was stabbed 100 times, decapitated, had his heart torn out of his chest. And then buried with it ...

utterances.speaker: BIRO
utterances.utterance: They're very reprehensible people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I have a whole rap sheet of some of these disgusting actions here. Why is your party soft peddling MS-13?

utterances.speaker: BIRO
utterances.utterance: I want to make sure that people understand that we are not embracing MS-13. That would be political death to us.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But why did Nancy Pelosi says that she saw like beauty in all of everyone's soul when she was talking about MS-13.

utterances.speaker: BIRO
utterances.utterance: I didn't like how she handled that at all. She was right to invoke her faith. Great, we are all God's children. That's great. Maybe some of these people can get born again, but I don't like the message. I wish to God that she hadn't been elected speaker again and I hope she doesn't win reelection.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wow, Tomi, I think we're changing people's mind on "Watters' World" right now. I'll give you the last word.

utterances.speaker: LAHREN
utterances.utterance: Well, I am glad that you're are admitting that MS-13 is a detriment to society, but this is bigger than just calling out MS-13. We have to look at illegal immigration because the fact of the matter is, these people are coming over here, many of them are illegal immigrants. So at the end of the day, you can call MS-13 what they are, but until you've acknowledged the problem with illegal immigration, we are still in the same boat.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, well, I mean, the Green Party doesn't even know who MS-13 is and they want them to come across the southern border on a bridge, so we have a lot of work to do. Tomi, Robin, thank you guys very much.

utterances.speaker: BIRO
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: A Trump supporter assaulted at a concert by the lead singer. You haven't even heard that anywhere, I bet. Diamond and Silk are here to weigh in. A supporter of President Trump said he was beaten and spit on by the lead singer of the punk band, Social Distortion for protesting the singer's criticism of Trump at a concert. Watch this. Wow, joining me now with their reaction, Diamond and Silk. All right, ladies, what do you think about this? I mean, this guy apparently was on stage saying America is a bunch of racists, he was ripping on ICE and Donald Trump so I think, a Trump supporter might have flipped him the bird. The next thing you know, the lead singer is jumping off the stage and punching him in the face.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND, VIDEO BLOGGER
utterances.utterance: Wow, well, there's nothing wrong with flipping anybody the bird, but it is against the law to assault somebody and this performer needs to be arrested for assault. It's so sad that people are being attacked based on the color of their politics, based on the fact that they love America and these people that stand on stage and perform in our country, if you don't love America, if you think it's racist, why are you taking our dollars? Go to another country.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This is another example of the media not reporting when a Trump supporter is assaulted. All right, you remember Donald Trump wants a big military parade? And he might have to put it off because, I think the local DC politicians and Democrats are giving him a little trouble about that. So they are all saying it's going to cost this much, it's going to cost that much, what a fake news about this. Now, Secretary of Defense "Mad Dog" Mattis was asked about the cost and here's what he had to say.

utterances.speaker: JAMES MATTIS, US SECRETARY OF DEFENSE
utterances.utterance: He mentioned $10 million or $92 million, whoever told you that is probably smoking something that's legal in my state, but not in most states, so I would discount that and anybody who said that, I almost guarantee you one thing, let's face it, I need to stay anonymous, no kidding because you'll look like an idiot. And number two, whoever wrote it, you can get better sources.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I love how the Defense Secretary is calling everybody pot smoking idiots. It's refreshing.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.utterance: Well, you know what though, this is why we call the fake news the fake news.

utterances.speaker: SILK, VIDEO BLOGGER
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.utterance: Because they always have some type of source. We don't know if they got it from the Cookie Monster or what. They throw out numbers. They throw oscillations live, and then they want to know we don't trust them. This is why we don't trust them. So "Mad Dog" Mattis has every right to be a little bit ticked off with the very fake news and their sources.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think you guys should be the grand marshals of the military parade, up on tanks, waving the flags. I'm going to talk to the President about that. we need to make that happen. All right, speaking of lies, Bill de Blasio, the mayor of New York City, a very liberal guy, has been criticizing Donald Trump for attacking the fake news media as the enemy of the people and he also wants to get rid of Fox News, so I wanted to show the audience a little flashback. I just tried to ask the guy a simple question why won't you come on "The O'reilly Factor" a few years ago. He had me escorted out of the press conference by armed security. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We have been trying to book you on the show for weeks and your staff hasn't been very respectful towards us. We're just trying to get you ...

utterances.speaker: BILL DE BLASIO, MAYOR OF NEW YORK CITY
utterances.utterance: I'm sure they were very respectful.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Actually not.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I am sure they are.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We are just trying to get to know you better. What's the problem?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: O appreciate the invitation and my staff will follow up with you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But they haven't been following up and that's why I am here.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I'm glad you're here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We're fascinated by the de Blasio mystique.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Let's take some serious questions. Go ahead, Henry.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Can you help us out, Mayor?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I've talked to you, my friend. Henry?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You haven't respond. Will you do the show?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Henry? Just start talking, Henry?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I need rescuing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You need rescuing. Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I never need rescuing. I just want a real question. Go ahead, Henry.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay, and then I was escorted out by one of his security guards for asking him a nice question. Double standard, right, ladies?

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.utterance: It is a double standard. Listen, what he wants to do is they want that the left and him wants to control and dominate and they want to us listen to fake news and to listen to what's really going on in our country.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.utterance: Kudos to Fox News.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.utterance: Yes, and did you get to meet Henry?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No. I have not met Henry. Henry was a lifeline. He needed some help over there. All right, ladies, Diamond and Silk, they don't need any help. They go it all under control. Up next, "Last Call." All right "Last Call." As you enjoy your summer weekened, "Watters' World" wants you to please, please be safe. Do not be like this guy in Estonia whose jet ski exploded. I don't know what happened here. I didn't even know jet skis could explode like that or had ejector seats, but the rider was apparently okay. There he goes. Shoots right him into the water and onto a nearby boat. He's all right. That's what counts, but please be safe. That's it for us tonight. Be sure to follow me on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter, "Justice With Judge Jeanine" is next. And remember, I am Watters and this is my world.
